page.title: 18Dialect in Ulverston
page.content: Dialect words are still part of everyday speech in Ulverston. The fol- lowing is an example. "I traipsed out of our ginnel. I was in a right epie and booted a l'al clemmy in t'dyke. I went t'park yonder and see'd a girt seapie. I took up mi buttie an' ligged it at it,but it jus' flew off. I recon it were a bit kysty. An' I recon it were nesh an' all cos it were reet kecken itsen. Then I went yam." In ordinary English this means: "I walked out of our alley. I was feeling really angry and kicked a small stone into the hedge. Then I made my way to the park over there and saw a big seagull. I took up my sand- wich and threw it to it,but it just flew off. I think it was being fussy and I think it was soft too because it seemed frightened.Then I went home."
